item.description:
The Flat is where it's at!

Built on made land in the 19th century, this intimate patch of real estate between the Charles River and Charles Street became the home of carriage houses and stables for the horses of wealthy families living on the Hill. Today, charmingly converted residences blend seamlessly with such landmarks as the Charles Street Meeting House and the Church of the Advent. 

Wile we explore, we'll see volunteers keeping with neighborhood tradition as they decorate the 1,100 gas lampposts on the Hill for the holidays.

No reservations necessary. $15 per person. For more information, visit www.bostonbyfoot.org or call us at 617-367-2345.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet your guide at the Charles/MGH T-stop on the Red Line, Charles and Cambridge Streets, Boston.
item.name: A Holiday Stroll: The Flat of Beacon Hill
